meanings.definition: To make timid or fearful through threats or bullying.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the fireworks could intimidate the scared dog.
meanings.sent2: The bully tried to intimidate the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten tried to intimidate the big dog by puffing up its fur.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to intimidate the sun, hiding its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look seemed to intimidate the misbehaving students into silence.

meanings.definition: To compel or deter by or as if by threats.
meanings.sent1: The warning signs were meant to intimidate people from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The criminal tried to intimidate the witness into not testifying in court.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to intimidate the birds away from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to intimidate the hikers from continuing their trek.
meanings.sent5: The security guard's presence alone was enough to intimidate troublemakers from causing any harm.
